macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Hits All-Time High in Santa Claus Rally
items.summary: The S&P 500 closed at a new all-time high amid a seasonal Santa Claus rally, breaking out above key levels like 6,920 with support at 6,720 and 6,840. The Cboe Volatility Index VIX reached new 2025 lows, supporting bullish buy signals.

items.title: S&P 500 All-Time High on Thin Holiday Volume
items.summary: In holiday-shortened trading on December 24, 2025, the S&P 500 reached a brand new all-time high despite thin volume, with trendline divergences noted in tech, small caps, and commodities.

items.title: US Stocks Grind Higher Toward Year-End Record
items.summary: US equities continued a quiet upward grind, with the S&P 500 closing near a record high in the holiday-shortened week; European stocks also advanced.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Ethereum drifts near $2,900 as ETF outflows and whale selling weigh
items.summary: Ethereum traded around $2,922, down ~1.5% over 24 hours, pressured by continued selling from large holders and seven consecutive days of spot-ETH ETF outflows led by BlackRock, while options expiries on Dec. 26 add potential volatility risk.

items.title: HashKey Capital raises $250M toward $500M blockchain fund target
items.summary: HashKey Capital announced a $250 million first close for its Fintech Multi-Strategy Fund IV, lifting its HK-listed stock and targeting a $500 million final size to invest in blockchain infrastructure and mass‑adoption use cases.

items.title: HashKey stock rises after $250M fundraising for crypto fund
items.summary: HashKey Capital said institutional commitments pushed initial fundraising to $250 million and the company plans further closings as it pursues a $500 million fund, triggering a ~4% uptick in its Hong Kong share price.

items.title: Review of 2025 crypto policy wins and outlook for 2026
items.summary: Analysts note crypto enjoyed key regulatory and policy developments in 2025 but prices still lagged; investors are now looking to potential U.S. federal actions (e.g., the Clarity Act) and a calmer macro backdrop in 2026 for catalysts.

items.title: Institutional accumulation: firm increases Bitcoin allocation significantly
items.summary: A corporate/asset manager cited in coverage has materially increased Bitcoin holdings (reported a ~767% rise over one-year span), underscoring ongoing institutional positioning in BTC amid a mixed price backdrop.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Daily roundup: smart-home assistant struggles, Samsung integrates Gemini into appliances, OpenAI personal analytics update
items.summary: AI Daily's Dec. 24 episode highlights generative assistants underperforming in smart homes, Samsung adding Google's Gemini AI to kitchen appliances, and OpenAI rolling out personal analytics features for ChatGPT users.

items.title: Industry panel warns AI can amplify existing data and governance problems in trading
items.summary: Speakers at the Finance Magnates London Summit cautioned that AI accelerates workflows but also magnifies data-quality and governance issues for traders, stressing the need for human oversight and robust controls.

items.title: Legal advisory: AI makes reverse engineering and trade-secret protection harder
items.summary: A legal review explains how modern AI tools lower barriers to reverse-engineering public products, raising trade-secret risks and legal uncertainty around techniques like data scraping and prompt injection.

items.title: Opinion: Simulation engineering converges with AI for next-generation CAE/FEM
items.summary: An industry piece argues that 2025 marks a turning point where computational power, physical realism, and AI combine to create 'AI-native' engineering simulation and finite-element workflows.

items.title: Coverage: ethical frameworks gain prominence in responsible AI development
items.summary: A December 24 commentary notes growing emphasis on ethical frameworks and governance as organizations deploy AI more widely, calling for stronger standards and accountability.

items.title: Healthcare security: tighter oversight needed for third‑party AI vendor risk
items.summary: Experts say increasing vendor AI use in healthcare introduces new third-party risks and requires stronger vendor management, security controls, and regulatory vigilance.

items.title: Research brief: NLP-driven analysis maps a century of global aging research
items.summary: A new paper uses NLP to map 100 years of aging research, demonstrating AI's value for large-scale literature synthesis and domain-mapping in biomedicine.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Nvidia reportedly to acquire chip startup Groq in major deal
items.summary: Reports say Nvidia agreed to acquire AI chip competitor Groq for about $20 billion, including a licensing deal and hiring Groq's founder Jonathan Ross, a move that would expand Nvidia's chip capabilities and market dominance in accelerators for large models.[1]

items.title: Nextech3D.ai provides update on Krafty Labs acquisition
items.summary: Nextech3D.ai confirmed completion of due diligence and said the acquisition of experiential event-tech firm Krafty Labs is scheduled to close on Jan. 2, 2026, outlining expected revenue and margin benefits for its event platform.[2]

items.title: Industry retrospectives and trend pieces highlight 2025 tech shifts
items.summary: Analyses published this week reflect on 2025 as a year of significant tech transformation—covering trends such as agentic systems, advances in quantum stability, and tighter hardware-software integration across industries.[3]

items.title: Automotive sector updates: Ford pivots to energy storage; GM air-bag probe continues
items.summary: Coverage of auto-industry developments includes Ford accelerating partnerships in energy storage and reports of ongoing probes into GM air-bag issues alongside macroeconomic context from recent GDP data.[5]

items.title: Payments commentary: BNPL's bottleneck is architecture, not scoring
items.summary: A payments industry analysis argues that buy-now-pay-later's core limitations are fragmented architectures and inconsistent reporting to credit bureaus, rather than credit scoring models, recommending tighter integration with bank data rails.[8]

items.title: Corporate appointments and optics in photonics and optics sector
items.summary: Several firms in the photonics and optics space announced leadership changes and advisory appointments this week, reflecting ongoing restructuring and board-level updates across the sector.[7]
